sense.name: a close_in military combat
sense.examples: The assault of the city involved a lot of hand-to-hand combat. It will require a bloody assault to take such a castle. The commando's assault of the facility occurred under cover of darkness.

sense.name: a personal physical attack
sense.examples: The man is serving a sentence for assault of a film director. The police record notes a decrease in sexual assaults this past year. It's his third time in court facing charges of assault.

sense.name: intense verbal criticism
sense.examples: It was an unabashed assault on the party's socialist-leaning tax policies. The film star has rightfully claimed that such assaults on her character constitute libel.

sense.name: a concerted attempt to achieve a goal
sense.examples: The climbers attempted a late spring assault of Mt. Everest. The book describes her assaults on the glass-ceiling of corporate culture during the 1960s.
